meanings.definition: The study or science of books and their history, production, and classification.
meanings.sent1: In her bibliologies class, she learned about the different types of books and how they are made.
meanings.sent2: The library's bibliologies section contains many books about the history of literature.
meanings.sent3: John's love for bibliologies led him to start a book club with his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast bibliologies, with each book representing a different chapter of her life.
meanings.sent5: The professor's passion for bibliologies made the subject come alive in the classroom.

meanings.definition: A collection of books on a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The bibliologies on ancient civilizations in the library fascinated me.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a valuable bibliologies of rare first editions from her grandfather.
meanings.sent3: His bibliologies on gardening took up an entire wall in his study.
meanings.sent4: The bibliologies of mystery novels in the bookstore beckoned to avid readers.
meanings.sent5: The bibliologies of cookbooks in the kitchen inspired her to try new recipes.

meanings.definition: The practice of collecting or owning books.
meanings.sent1: Her bibliologies included books from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: The bibliologies of antique books in the store caught the eye of collectors.
meanings.sent3: His bibliologies grew so large that he needed a new bookshelf every month.
meanings.sent4: The bibliologies of rare manuscripts in the museum were carefully preserved.
meanings.sent5: The bibliologies of science fiction novels in his room showcased his love for the genre.
